Uses of Interface
javax.constraints.Constraint

Uses of Constraint in javax.constraints
 

Methods in javax.constraints that return Constraint
 Constraint Problem.add(Constraint constraint)
          Adds a Constraint "constraint" to the problem, then returns the constraint.
 Constraint Problem.allDifferent(Var[] vars)
          Creates and returns a new Constraint stating that all of the elements of the array of variables "vars" must take different values from each other.
 Constraint Constraint.and(Constraint c)
          Returns an "AND" Constraint.
 Constraint Problem.cardinality(Var[] vars, int cardValue, Oper oper, int value)
          This method creates and returns a new cardinality constraint such as “cardinality(vars,cardValue) < value”.
 Constraint Problem.cardinality(Var[] vars, int cardValue, Oper oper, Var var)
          This method is similar to the one above but instead of “value” the “cardinality(vars,cardValue)” is being constrained by “var”.
 Constraint Problem.cardinality(Var[] vars, Var cardVar, Oper oper, int value)
          This method is similar to the one above but instead of “var” it uses "value"
 Constraint Problem.cardinality(Var[] vars, Var cardVar, Oper oper, Var var)
          This method is similar to the one above but instead of “cardValue” it uses "cardVar"
 Constraint Problem.constraint(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String symbolicExpression)
          Creates a Constraint based on the symbolicExpression such as "x*y-z<3*r", adds this constraint to the problem, and returns the newly added Constraint.
 Constraint Problem.element(int[] array, Var indexVar, Oper oper, int value)
          Returns a constraint: array[indexVar] value Here "array[indexVar]" denotes a constrained integer variable, which domain consists of integers array[i] where i is within domain of the "indexVar".
 Constraint Problem.element(int[] array, Var indexVar, Oper oper, Var var)
          Returns a constraint: array[indexVar] var Here "array[indexVar]" denotes a constrained integer variable, which domain consists of integers array[i] where i is within domain of the "indexVar".
 Constraint Problem.element(Var[] vars, Var indexVar, Oper oper, int value)
          Returns a constraint: vars[indexVar] value
 Constraint Problem.element(Var[] vars, Var indexVar, Oper oper, Var var)
          Returns a constraint: vars[indexVar] var
 Constraint VarReal.eq(double value)
          Adds and returns a Constraint that represents that this variable must be equal to the given value i.e.
 Constraint VarReal.eq(int value)
          Adds and returns a Constraint that represents that this variable must be equal to the given value i.e.
 Constraint Var.eq(int value)
          Adds and returns a Constraint that represents that this variable must be equal to the given value i.e.
 Constraint VarReal.eq(Var var)
          Adds and returns a Constraint that represents that this variable must be equal to the given variable, i.e.
 Constraint Var.eq(Var var)
          Adds and returns a Constraint that represents that this variable must be equal to the given variable, i.e.
 Constraint VarReal.eq(VarReal var)
          Adds and returns a Constraint that represents that this variable must be equal to the given variable, i.e.
 Constraint VarReal.ge(double value)
          Adds and returns a Constraint that represents that this variable must be greater than or equal to the given value, i.e.
 Constraint VarReal.ge(int value)
          Adds and returns a Constraint that represents that this variable must be greater than or equal to the given value, i.e.
 Constraint Var.ge(int value)
          Adds and returns a Constraint that represents that this variable must be greater than or equal to the given value, i.e.
 Constraint VarReal.ge(Var var)
          Adds and returns a Constraint that represents that this variable must be greater than or equal to the given variable, i.e.
 Constraint Var.ge(Var var)
          Adds and returns a Constraint that represents that this variable must be greater than or equal to the given variable, i.e.
 Constraint VarReal.ge(VarReal var)
          Adds and returns a Constraint that represents that this variable must be greater than or equal to the given variable, i.e.
 Constraint Problem.getConstraint(java.lang.String name)
          Returns the Constraint the name "name", or null if no such constraints exists in the problem.
 Constraint[] Problem.getConstraints()
          Returns an array of Constraints previously added to the problem.
 Constraint Problem.globalCardinality(Var[] vars, Var[] cardinalityVars)
          This method is similar to the globalCardinality(Var[] vars, Var[] cardinalityVars, int[] values) where the array “values” is fixed to an array of integers from 0 to (cardinalityVars.length – 1).
 Constraint Problem.globalCardinality(Var[] vars, Var[] cardinalityVars, int[] values)
          This method counts the numbers of occurrences of integer values from a given array "values" among the constrained variables from a given array "vars" and associates these numbers with a given array “cardinalityVars”.
 Constraint Problem.globalCardinality(Var[] vars, Var[] cardinalityVars, Var[] valueVars)
          This method counts the numbers of occurrences of integer values that may instantiate variables of a given array "valueVars" among the constrained variables from a given array "vars" and associates these numbers with a given array “cardinalityVars”.
 Constraint VarReal.gt(double value)
          Adds and returns a Constraint that represents that this variable must be greater than the given value, i.e.
 Constraint VarReal.gt(int value)
          Adds and returns a Constraint that represents that this variable must be greater than the given value, i.e.
 Constraint Var.gt(int value)
          Adds and returns a Constraint that represents that this variable must be greater than the given value, i.e.
 Constraint VarReal.gt(Var var)
          Adds and returns a Constraint that represents that this variable must be greater than the given variable, i.e.
 Constraint Var.gt(Var var)
          Adds and returns a Constraint that represents that this variable must be greater than the given variable, i.e.
 Constraint VarReal.gt(VarReal var)
          Adds and returns a Constraint that represents that this variable must be greater than the given variable, i.e.
 Constraint Constraint.implies(Constraint c)
          Returns a Constraint that states the implication: this => c.
 Constraint VarReal.le(double value)
          Adds and returns a Constraint that represents that this variable must be less than or equal to the given value, i.e.
 Constraint VarReal.le(int value)
          Adds and returns a Constraint that represents that this variable must be less than or equal to the given value, i.e.
 Constraint Var.le(int value)
          Adds and returns a Constraint that represents that this variable must be less than or equal to the given value, i.e.
 Constraint VarReal.le(Var var)
          Adds and returns a Constraint that represents that this variable must be less than or equal to the given variable, i.e.
 Constraint Var.le(Var var)
          Adds and returns a Constraint that represents that this variable must be less than or equal to the given variable, i.e.
 Constraint VarReal.le(VarReal var)
          Adds and returns a Constraint that represents that this variable must be less than or equal to the given variable, i.e.
 Constraint Problem.linear(int[] array, Var[] vars, Oper oper, int value)
          Returns a constraint: array*vars value
 Constraint Problem.linear(int[] array, Var[] vars, Oper oper, Var var)
          Returns a constraint: array*vars var
 Constraint Problem.linear(Var[] vars, Oper oper, int value)
          Returns a constraint: sum of vars value
 Constraint Problem.linear(Var[] vars, Oper oper, Var var)
          Returns a constraint: sum of vars var
 Constraint Problem.linear(Var var, Oper oper, int value)
          Returns a constraint: var value
 Constraint Problem.linear(Var var1, Oper oper, Var var2)
          Returns a constraint: var1 var2
 Constraint Problem.linear(Var var1, Var var2, Oper oper, int value)
          Returns a constraint: (var1 + var2) value
 Constraint Problem.linear(Var var1, Var var2, Oper oper, Var var)
          Returns a constraint: (var1 + var2) var
 Constraint VarReal.lt(double value)
          Adds and returns a Constraint that represents that this variable must be less than the given value, i.e.
 Constraint VarReal.lt(int value)
          Adds and returns a Constraint that represents that this variable must be less than the given value, i.e.
 Constraint Var.lt(int value)
          Adds and returns a Constraint that represents that this variable must be less than the given value, i.e.
 Constraint VarReal.lt(Var var)
          Adds and returns a Constraint that represents that this variable must be less than the given variable, i.e.
 Constraint Var.lt(Var var)
          Adds and returns a Constraint that represents that this variable must be less than the given variable, i.e.
 Constraint VarReal.lt(VarReal var)
          Adds and returns a Constraint that represents that this variable must be less than the given variable, i.e.
 Constraint VarReal.ne(double value)
          Adds and returns a Constraint that represents that this variable must not be equal to the given value, i.e.
 Constraint VarReal.ne(int value)
          Adds and returns a Constraint that represents that this variable must not be equal to the given value, i.e.
 Constraint VarReal.ne(Var var)
          Adds and returns a Constraint that represents that this variable must not be equal to the given variable, i.e.
 Constraint VarReal.ne(VarReal var)
          Adds and returns a Constraint that represents that this variable must not be equal to the given variable, i.e.
 Constraint Constraint.negation()
          Returns a Constraint that is satisfied if and only if this constraint is not satisfied.
 Constraint Var.neq(int value)
          Adds and returns a Constraint that represents that this variable must not be equal to the given value, i.e.
 Constraint Var.neq(Var var)
          Adds and returns a Constraint that represents that this variable must not be equal to the given variable, i.e.
 Constraint Constraint.or(Constraint c)
          Returns an "OR" Constraint.
 

Methods in javax.constraints with parameters of type Constraint
